1/5: Thread: 👇Just catching up on the absolutely damning & absolutely accurate assessment of the state of the UK's finest sites for nature -#SSSIs - and the regulators that are meant to protect them by @charlottebsmith with Emma Rose of @Unchecked_UK on tonight's @BBCCountryfile

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
How many other rivers in England are having vast amounts of raw sewage dumped into them at this very second? "Exceptional circumstance"?

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/8rarB1lphZ

@Steveyp11 @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Spoke to the fishermen this morning during my dog walk, not good, they were disgusted. 5am discharge apparently, large volume of raw sewage, very sneaky early hours so on a normal night no one would notice, ruined the night match and lots went home. Not acceptable!!!!!

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Had some mates fishing a Barbel match on the river Derwent in Derbyshire on Saturday , match was cancelled halfway through due to a raw sewage discharge up stream, one mate is now ill after removing human waste off his line, total disgrace 😡.

This image can be restored with a click.. @BorisJohnson @Conservatives @HS2ltd you cant just click your fingers and restore ancient woodland with a stick! Even if you plants thousands of them! https://t.co/tdqeKYiOGs

tweets.text:
Rivers are just like the tube network for migratory fish and their path is often blocked by locks or weirs. The Roadmap project focuses on mapping these to provide a blueprint for strategic steps to improve connectivity.
@EnvAgency @LondonNPC @theriverstrust @fishmigration https://t.co/iHFVswBOIo

The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks

tweets.text:
Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people admit to having flushed down the loo. 
 
However, unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve and instead causes blockages. 
 
Never flush kitchen roll. 
 
Protect your pipes and our environment.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/NUg5UumjEq

It is not even certain that those planted plants will be taken care of,As seen in the past.We urge you to think about the present situation and find an alternative space for the international project where no damage to the environment is done.That way animals, trees & development
